com.oceanoptics.omnidriver.features.continuousstrobe

Interface ContinuousStrobe


  • public interface ContinuousStrobe
    Interface for devices with support for a continuous strobe. Intended devices are HR2000+, HR4000, QE65000, USB2000+, USB4000, ADC1000USB.

    • Method Detail

      • setContinuousStrobeDelay

        void setContinuousStrobeDelay(int durationOfPhase)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Set the delay (in microseconds) from the start of the integration period until we turn on the lamp for the first pulse. This value will also be used to specify the duration of each lamp-on pulse. Thus pulses will have a 50% duty cycle. The underlying commands are expected to be:
        • ADC1000: OP_CONTSTROBE (0x0C)
        • HR2000+, HR4000: OP_FPGAWRITE (0x6A)
        Parameters:
        durationOfPhase - Specifies the duration of the lamp-off and lamp-on phases of each light pulse. When the integration period begins, the lamp will remain off for this length of time. Then the lamp will turn on for the same duration. This cycle of equal duration periods of lamp-off/lamp-on is then continued until the integration period has completed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown if the delay cannot be sent to the device.

      • getContinuousStrobeDelay

        java.lang.Integer getContinuousStrobeDelay()
        Get the currently set continuous strobe delay. Note that the device may not support reading this property directly, so a cached value or null may be returned.
        Returns:
        Integer containing the continuous strobe delay in microseconds, or null if the state cannot be determined and setContinuousStrobeDelay has not yet been called.

      • getContinuousStrobeDelayMinimum

        int getContinuousStrobeDelayMinimum()
        Smallest continuous strobe delay, in microseconds, that the device supports.
        Returns:
        Minimum strobe delay in microseconds

      • getContinuousStrobeDelayMaximum

        int getContinuousStrobeDelayMaximum()
        Largest continuous strobe delay, in microseconds, that the device supports.
        Returns:
        Maximum strobe delay in microseconds

      • getContinuousStrobeDelayIncrement

        int getContinuousStrobeDelayIncrement(int magnitude)
        Step size for strobe delay values, in microseconds. This is provided for SpinnerNumberModel support.
        Parameters:
        magnitude - How large the current strobe delay is, in case that changes the minimum increment value
        Returns:
        Step size, in microseconds, for the continuous strobe delay

      • continuousStrobeCountsToMicros

        double continuousStrobeCountsToMicros(int counts)
        Converts the given number of counts to microseconds.
        Parameters:
        counts - Integer number of counts to convert
        Returns:
        corresponding number of microseconds

      • setContinuousModeType

        void setContinuousModeType(boolean mode)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Determines whether the continuous strobe is in sync with integration time or out-of-sync.
        Parameters:
        mode - Asynchronous mode if false or Synchronous mode if true.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown if the delay cannot be sent to the device.

      • getContinuousModeType

        boolean getContinuousModeType()
        Get continuous strobe mode type *
        Returns:
        true if synchronous or false if asynchronous mode

      • setDelayAfterIntegration

        void setDelayAfterIntegration(int delay)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Set a delay offset from the start of integration.
        Parameters:
        delay - Integer number for delay in microseconds.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown if the delay cannot be sent to the device.

      • getDelayAfterIntegration

        int getDelayAfterIntegration()
        Get delay offset from the start of integration.
        Returns:
        delay in microseconds

      • setContinuousEnable

        void setContinuousEnable(boolean value)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Set continuous mode enabled or disabled.
        Parameters:
        value - enable value true or false
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on error.

      • getContinuousEnable

        boolean getContinuousEnable()
        Determine if continuous mode is enabled.
        Returns:
        true if continuous mode is enabled, false otherwise.
